I.A: New Zealand (Oceania)
Travel over both New Zealand's islands in summer.
Travel from Czech Republic to New Zealand
Flight from Prague to Seoul

Departure from Prague, Ruzyne 2/9/2006 19:50.
Duration 10:30 hours.
Arrival to Incheon (near Seoul) 2/10/2006 14:10.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: South Korea, Incheon

The Seoul's airport is located about 100km from city on Incheon island.
Small trip around the island.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Flight from Seoul to Christchurch

Departure from Seoul, Incheon 2/10/2006 21:30.
Duration 12 hours.
Arrival to Christchurch 2/11/2006 13:30.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: South Island

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Christchurch – capital of the South Island, 320 000 inhabitans.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Bank Peninsula
About 40 km from Christchurch is very old volcano on Bank Peninsula. The volcano sunk to the sea, only a bay left after it.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Mount Somers
Mount Somers is about 100km far from Christchurch. There in Rangitata Valley was the site of filming of parts of the Lord of the Ring films and the Castle of Edoras capital of the realm of Rohan.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Mount Cook

From Mount Sommers to Mount Cook is about 150 km via MacKenzie Country.
Mount Cook is the highest mountains on New Zealand, with the highest peak Mount Cook / Aorangi (3754m).
In Mount Cook are many Kea parrots.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Mount Cook - Ball Pass Track
Crossing Ball Pass around the highest peak Mount Cook. It takes two days.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Mount Cook - Tasman Glacier and Blue Lakes
The Ball Pass Track ends by Tasman Glacier and Blue lakes.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Drive to south
Drive from Mount Cook to Te Anau, via Mount Aspiring and Queenstown. About 500km.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Te Anau
Te Anau town, located by Te Anau lake. This town is base point for tracks in Fiordland (south-west of South Island).

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Milford Track
Probably the best know track on New Zealand. The four days track along two rivers and with crossing Mackinnon Pass.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Milford Sound
Milford Sound - the end of Milford Track. The port for cruisers. Very rainy place.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Small town near Queenstown, by Wakatipu lake.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Queenstown is the main touring centre in the south. It is situated by Wakatipu lake, below peak Ben Lemond (1748m). Views from Ben Lemond.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Rees Dart Track and Cascade Saddle Route

The track in Mount Aspiring, from Glenorchy. Circular track via Rees valley and Rees pass, with extension to Cascade saddle and Pilon (1835m) and back via Darts valley. Views to the highest peak Mount Aspiring / Tititea (3027m). The track length was about 110 km.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Queenstown surround
Kawarau river and Kawarau bridge. Drive from Glenorchy to Wanaka.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Wanaka town by Wanaka lake.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Trip to Rob Roy Glacier
Track from Wanaka to Rob Roy glacier. The valley to Cascade saddle and Pilon.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Drive to Westland
Drive from Wanaka to west coast, about 300km.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Fox and Franz Josef glaciers
The most know glaciers in New Zealand. The glaciers are great attraction and are prepared for crossing.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Drive from glaciers via west coast to the north, about 600 km.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Westland - Queen Elizabeth Track
Short track along the sea.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Westland - Pancake Rocks
Pancake rocks and cove. Standard tourist attraction.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Our campside

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Coastal Track
The four day track, the next New Zealand's Great walk. Very easy track along the sea.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: North coast
Drive to Picton.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Picton, small town. From picton leaves ferry to Wellington on North Island.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Ferry to North Island
Ferry from Picton to Wellington. It takes about three hours.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: North Island

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Wellington, the capital of New Zealand. It has about 330 000 inhabitans. There is Ta Papa Atawhai museum. Views from Mount Victoria.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Mount Egmont / Taranaki is about 400 km from Wellington. It is one conical volcano in flat country on the coast. Very famous peak on New Zealand.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Lost Word Highway
Lost Word Highway from Taranaki to Tongariro, about 200 km long.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Tongariro nothern circuit track

Tongariro, the oldest national park in New Zealand.
Tongariro northern circuit is three days track via Tongariro volcano and around NGauruhoe (2295m) volcano. This volcano is still active, the last erruption was in 1975. NGauruhoe is typical conical volcano.
In this region was situated Mordor from Lord of the Rings.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Rupeahu (2796m), the highest peak of the North Island and the highest volcano on New Zealand. It is still active, the last erruptions were in 1995 and 1996.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Taupo, the largest lake in New Zealand. It is 40km long and 30km wide. It occupies the crater of old volcano.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Orakei Korako thermal reserve
Thermal reserve with hot springs, geysers, mud pools. Standard tourist attraction.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Crater of the Moon
Next thermal reserve. Mainly steam and mud pools.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Huka falls
Huka falls, known as the most beautiful falls in New Zealand.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Volcana beyond Taupo
Trip to extinct volcano beyond the Taupo town.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Next day in Taupo.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Wai-o-tapu Thermal Wonderland
Next thermal reserve, mainly with hot pools.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Whakarewarewa Thermal Reserve
Thermal park in Rotorua town, includes Maori village.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Campside in Rotoroua
Campside in Rotorua, also with mud pools.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Whakarewarewa - Hangi
Hangi - the evening with Maori culture.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Campside in Rotoroua
Next fotos from the campside.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Burried Village
The village burried by volcano 100 years ago. Nothing to see.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Blue and Green lakes
Two lakes near Rotorua.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Lake in Rotorua.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Peninsula Coromandel is mainly used as trip destination for Auckland inhabitans.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Karangahake Gorge
Abandoned gold mines on Coromandel.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Coromandel's north coast
Beaches on the north of Coromandel. The Catedral Grove.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Coromandel - Kauri
On Coromandel there are big old trees named Kauri. Kauri can be up to 2000 years old, on Coromandel are oldest about 1200 years.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Track on the west coast on Coromandel.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A:
Auckland is the biggest city on New Zealand, 1 300 000 inhabitans. But such large village with small centrum with skyscrapers. It is about three times larger then London.
Views from Sky Tower (328m) and from Mount Victoria (81m). Auckland Domain park.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Travel from New Zealand to Czech Republic
Flight from Auckland to Seoul

Departure from Auckland 3/19/2006 19:30.
Duration 11:40 hours.
Arrival to Incheon (near Seoul) 3/20/2006 4:10.
All flight was on night.
Seoul, the capital of South Korea. 10.73 millions inhabitans.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Flight from Seoul to Prague

Departure from Seoul 3/20/2006 14:40.
Duration 11:40 hours.
Arrival to Prague, Ruzyne 3/20/2006 18:20.
Bulgaria (Europe)
Passing of Bulgarian mountains Pirin and Rila.
Pirin Mountain

Pirin Mountain is located in south-west area of Bulgaria, southward from Bulgarian capital Sofia (about 100km). It has quite little area (about 200 km2) , but it is rocky and in contrast to Rila Mountain it looks very alpine. The highest peak is Vihren (2914m).
Melnik, Zlatolist, Rozensky Monastir, Kiselec

Trip from Melnik (500m), via Zlatolist village (300m), Rozensky Monastir (650m), Rozen village to Kiselec (1338m). Views of sand rocks Goljam Kljuch (424m), Sveti Spas (670m), Sveti Ilja (721m) and Rozensky Monastir from top.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Kiselec, h Pirin, Tevno Ezero

Trip from Kiselec (1338m) via Petrova Carkva (1443m), valley Vlaski Pat and pass H. Kamenica (1650m) to Pirin cottage (1550m). Continue in valley of creek Zeleznica around Mitrovo lake via pass by Smirnenski hill (2679m) to Tevno lake and Valjaviski Sukar (2664m). Views of Hleven (2645m), Zeleznik (2673m) and Krivec (2709m) on the right and Jalovarnika (2763m) and Kamenica (2822m) on the left. Views of valley with Malokameniski lakes. Evening views of Pirin on the North.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Edge Tevno Ezero - Glavniska Porta, h Vichren

Trip from Tevno lake via Mozgoviska pass (2550m) and along edge via Vinarska Porta pass, Prevalski Cukar (2604m), Goljamata Strana (2644m), Goljam Tipic (2645m) to Glavniska pass and down around Dalgo lake, Todorina pass and Okoto lake to Vichren cottage and Banderica campside (1800m). Views of Polenski lakes valley, Glavniski lakes, Glavniski Sukar (2720m), Banderiski Sukar (2731m), Ribno lake, Hvojnati Vrah (2635m), Vihren (2914m) and Kutelo (2908m) on the left and Valjavica creek valley, Vasilaski lakes, Malka Todorka (2712m) and Todorin Vrah (2746m) on the right.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: h Vichren, edge Vichren - Suchodolski Preval, h Javorov

Trip from campside Banderica (1800m) via Kazana cottage to Vichren (2914m). Continue along edge around Kutelo (2908m), via Banski Suchodol (2884m), Konceto cottage, Bajuvi Dubki (2820m), Kamenica (2726m) to Suchodolski Preval (2550m). And down around Suchodolsko lake to Javorov cottage (1750m).
Views from Vichren to all Pirin Mountains, to valley with Cernata Voda creek, to Bansko and Razlog towns. Views of Vichren and Kutelo. View of Rila Mountain afar.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: h Javorov - Predel (campside)
Trip from Javorov cottage (1750m), via pass (2250m) next to Garbic to Predel (950m), pass between Pirin and Rila Mountain.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Rila Mountain

Rila Mountain is located in south-west area of Bulgaria, northward from Pirin Mountain and southward from Bulgarian capital Sofia (about 60km). It is larger then Pirin Mountain (about 350 km2). It mostly contains rounded hills, only the central area is rocky. The highest peak is Musala (2925m).
Predel, edge Kapatnik - German

Climb from Predel (950m) to Kapatnik (2170). Continue along edge via Skačkovec (2351m), Rusalija (2359m), Ravnik (2410m), Ezernik (2485m) to German (2484m). Views of Pirin afar. Views of Goljam Meci Vrah (2617), Kukov Vrah (2411m) and to Parangalica area.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: German, h Makedonia, Cerna Poljana, h Ribni Ezera

Trip from German (2484m), via Malak Meci Vrah (2474m), Makedonia cottage (2100m), Goljam Meci Vrah (2617m), Angelov Vrah (2643m), Goljama Pastrica (2606m), Sedloto pass (2350m), Pastri Slap (2683m), Cerna Poljana (2716m) to Pavlev Vrch (2667m). And down to Ribni Ezera cottage (2250m). Trip to Smradlivo lake. Views of Ilijna creek valley, Mramorec (2602m), Skalec (2678m), Ribni lakes, Rilska river valley, Siskovica (2669m) and Vodni Vrah (2683m),

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: h Ribni Ezera, Vodni Vrah, Kobilino Braniste, h Majlovica

Trip from Ribni Ezera cottage (2250m) via Marinkovica creek valley (2150m), Vodni Vrah (2683m), Kobilino Braniste pass (2145m) to Popovokapski Preval pass (2500m). Down to Maljovica cottage (1986m).
Views of area Centralen Rilski Rezervat, Lopuski Vrah (2698m), Gojlama Popova Kapa (2704m), Goljam Kupen (2731m) and Maljovica creek valley.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: h Majlovica, Orlovec, Majlovica, Razdela, Rilski Monastir

Trip from Maljovica cottage (1986) to Orlovec cottage and Razdavski Preval (2621m) and back.
Trip from Majlovica cottage around Elenski lakes, via Elin Vrah (2654m) to Maljovica (2729m). Continue via Goljam Mramorec (2602m), Dodov Vrah (2661m), Vazov Vrah (2669m), Varla (2593m) and down via Baucer (2152m) to Rilski Monastir (1000m).
Views of Rilska river valley, Maljovica creek valley, Lovnica (2695m), Usite (2547m), Elenski Lakes, Urdini lakes, Maljoviski lakes and Rilski Monastir.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Rilski Monastir
Rilski monastir, famous clerical building in the Rila Mountain.

I.AFormat: |0||||

I.A: Sofia, Bulgarian capital in the evening.

I.AFormat: |0||||
